item.title: 03 - don't raise
item.description: You donâ€™t raise or throw exceptions, you return errors. get pdf here ðŸ–¨ There is a lot of code blocks like this in go: fileInfo, err := os.Stat(filename) if err != nil { return fmt.Errorf("could not stat file, err: %v", err) } Each time you encounter a possibility of error you handle it immediately. You return it and let caller deal with it or you just log it and move on.
